item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Monday, October 14, 2024 at 3:25 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Starship Flight 5: Launch and booster catch [video] (1666 points | 986 comments)
2. Zero-latency SQLite storage in every Durable Object (119 points | 45 comments)
3. Refurb weekend: the Symbolics MacIvory Lisp machine I have hated (72 points | 18 comments)
4. Show HN: A VSCode Extension to edit HTML visually in real-time (22 points | 12 comments)
5. Making the Tibetan language a first-class citizen in the digital world (176 points | 78 comments)
6. Python client for the $20 Colmi R02 smart ring (18 points | 3 comments)
7. Counterintuitive Properties of High Dimensional Space (67 points | 18 comments)
8. The quiet art of attention (358 points | 112 comments)
9. Introducing Our New Name (94 points | 42 comments)
10. Show HN: I built Bazaari.io to make launching online stores simple and fast (24 points | 21 comments)
11. Transforming Colors with Matrices (16 points | 2 comments)
12. All asteroids in Solar System, visualized (44 points | 17 comments)
13. Diffusion for World Modeling (412 points | 196 comments)
14. Sears Homes 1915-1920 (6 points | discuss)
15. FriendlyElec NanoPi R5S as PTP Grandmaster Clock with GNSS/GPS Discipline (2022) (16 points | 3 comments)
16. Christopher Columbus may have been Spanish and Jewish, documentary says (55 points | 95 comments)
17. Honeybee: Calling via XMPP (5 points | discuss)
18. Lessons learned from profiling an algorithm in Rust (104 points | 17 comments)
19. Common Lisp implementation of the Forth 2012 Standard (102 points | 62 comments)
20. A novel channel contention mechanism for improving wi-fi's reliability (74 points | 27 comments)
21. Node.js, Pipes, and Disappearing Bytes (71 points | 29 comments)
22. CRLF is obsolete and should be abolished (316 points | 186 comments)
23. Plop Boot Manager (18 points | 5 comments)
24. Show HN: Chain Traverser – Fast Ethereum graph explorer (46 points | 3 comments)
25. 20x faster convergence for diffusion models (6 points | discuss)
26. Ward Christensen (of BBS and XMODEM fame) has died (230 points | 54 comments)
27. Even a single bacterial cell can sense the seasons changing (63 points | 20 comments)
28. Llama 405B 506 tokens/second on an H200 (9 points | 4 comments)
29. DARPA is funding reef structures that will be colonized by corals and bivalves (112 points | 26 comments)
30. A camera in the East Village, capturing the now and the long ago (12 points | 1 comment)
